Comment: >The misguided assumption beneath this hyper-partisan fallacy is that refusing to hold one’s own side to account is an advantage. The conservative movement operates largely on a poisonous distrust of any mainstream institution dedicated to upholding standards (journalism, science, academia). Growing swaths of the left, having seen Trump ride to power on a wave of cult-like obedience, have now decided that maintaining any standards for their leaders is a sucker’s game.  The author calls this a misguided assumption and later posits that politicians on the right simply "take longer" to receive their inevitable comeuppance.   >Although conservatives may take longer to pay a price for failing to restrain their mad king[...]  That just doesn't mesh with reality. The consequences literally never come, it's not a misguided assumption to understand that.   Whether that sort of strategy is viable on the left is an entirely different discussion, but it's absolutely a valid and extremely successful tactic for the right.
Author: thrawtes

Comment: This guy just wants to shit on people because he can. Calling the Biden debate performance "barely coherent" shows his own biases toward hyperbolic statements at the expense of others. Underneath it all, Chait is just an i-am-really-smart enlightened centrist unwilling to actually form an opinion that isn't simply contrarian mush.
